Amusement Parks in Bangalore

Wonderla, Innovative Film City, Fun World Amusement Park, Snow City, Neeladri Amusement Park, Fantasy Lagoon Water Park, Xtreme Zone Getawayz, Water World, Star City Amusement Park, SMAAASH & many other amazing parks.

Explore the recreational side of Bangalore with a visit to amusement parks. Whether it is some splashing adventure with water rides or some enthralling games in an indoor facility, amusement parks in Bangalore promise a full day of fun with your loved ones. Offering a unique experience to make you forget the mundane affairs of life, one should definitely try to pay a visit to these places in Bangalore.

Offering a range of entertainment options for all age groups, one can look forward to having a rejoicing day at Bangalore amusement parks. Wonderla, a popular choice for visitors, will delight you with a plethora of adrenaline rushing slides and rides like Boomerang, Harakiri, and Twisters. Innovative Film City will offer you a unique experience of the movie and glamour world with its countless sections of rides, shops, and eateries.  Enter the world of fun at Fun World Amusement Park.

It is the ultimate destination for locals and tourists alike with attractions like Fun World, Water World, Wow World and Snow City. Moreover, amusement parks like Crazy Waters and Neeladari Park are a great way to escape the daily grind in Bangalore without venturing out of the city. One can look forward to having a great adventure with friends and family and make some beautiful memories while visiting these amusement parks in Bangalore.

Here are some of the best amusement parks in Bangalore

01

Wonderla

Boasting of its only indoor musical fountain in India, a mind-boggling locale that can never, ever be all covered in a day. So, just in case you are planning for amazing stuff to do in Bangalore, pay a visit to Wonder la. For it shall take just a day to explore what’s on land, another set of days to figure out water and other unique nowhere to be found adventures.

Apart from the vivid rides, there are some virtual-real, blended activities. And if you are a little sleepy you can head to the lazy river here. To name a few, adventures of chikku and Cinemagic 3D are two must take experiences that are in perfect synchronization with the visual content in reality! It’s a bet that this name has to be on top in the list if searching for best amusement parks in Bangalore.

Location: 28 Kms away from Bengaluru, on Mysore Road.

Timings: 11 am to 6 pm on weekdays, from 11 am to 7 pm on weekends and holidays.

Entry fees: 890 INR for adults, 720 INR for children and senior citizens, and 150 INR for toddlers on regular days; INR 1,120 for adults, INR 890 for children and senior citizens, and INR 150 for kids on peak days.

02

Innovative Film City

An essence of European and Rome architecture is very evident here. A shooting spot for movies, this locale has much more than the fun rides and kid’s play.

The dinosaur park, Mirror Maze, Tussauds wax museum, 4D theatre and Cartoon city are just the starting point of this great adventure. You can also play some golf around or stroll in the in-house market with renowned showrooms. Welcome to the film city!

Location: 24 & 26, Kiadb Estates,birmangla cross, Bidali Industrial Area, Bengaluru

Timings: 11 am to 7 pm

Entry fees: 600 per person before 3 pm and 400 afternoons.

03

Snow City

Image Credit : snowcityblr.com

Nothing gives more relief than the chilled cold water in the summer heat. But this locale is just not chilled, it is frozen! The artificial snow here is completely safe as it is created with an eco-friendly method.

Apart from the snow, you can also take pleasure in 5D theatre inside the Snow City. The best part is that you don’t need to carry any extra clothing as the boots, gloves and jackets are all made available at the entrance itself. Go dancing, bailing, sliding or zorbing and feel one of the thrilling day in Bangalore.

Location: Jayamahal, Fun World Complex, Opposite TV Tower, J C Nagar, Bengaluru

Timings: 11 am to 5:30 pm

Entry fees: INR 390 per person on weekdays, and INR 490 during the weekends and on peak days.

GRS Fantasy Parks

An absolute fantasy world and one of the finest amusement parks in Bangalore. Spin in the Aqua tornado or go dance in the water disco, if not this then try rock climbing or the freefall crazy cruise. These are a few options out of many you can choose to invest your time on.

This locale has also got a sweet little souvenir shop just in case you wish to take some cute gifts back home. A lavish banquet hall is also present, in case you wish to have a good memory here. You can save up the budget if you land here in a big troop as this park offers you a discount in case you are from a particular college or school.

Location: Off KRS Road, Metagalli, Mysuru.

Timings: 10:30 am to 6 pm

Entry fees: Varies between 600 to 700 INR.

05

Water World

Get your adrenaline rushing at one of the most enthralling and largest water parks in Bangalore. It is one of the most prominent themed parks where you can have a fulfilling adventure with your kids. Encompassed by lush greenery, Water World is an entertaining visit for the little ones who can enjoy at the toys and play area built for the kids.

Some of the popular rides here include the Cyclone, Hurricane Cone and Devil’s Drop. One can enjoy here either by hopping into a pool or just lazing around in the river after a blood pumping ride.

Location: Palace Grounds, Opposite to TV Tower, J.C.Nagar, Bengaluru

Timings: Open on all days of the week from 11:00 AM to 4:30 PM

Entry Fees: INR 750 per person

SMAAASH

Promising a full day of entertainment, SMAAASH is one of the amusement parks in Bangalore where you can enjoy a number of activities with your loved ones. It is a perfect stop if you are going with people of different age groups.

It is a fun place where you can combine virtual reality experience with sports, dining and music at one place. Some of the popular activities which you can enjoy here are Smaash cricket, super keeper, fly max, walk the plank, twilight bowling, finger coaster, etc.

Location: 1 MG Lido Mall, MG Road, Bangalore

Timings: 11.00 AM TO 11.00 PM (Mon-Thu)
11.00 AM TO 1.00 AM (Fri-Sat)
11.00 AM TO 11.00 PM (Sun)

Entry Fees: Starting at INR 449

07

Fun World Amusement Park

This one is quite popular for several worlds, the fun, water, and wow world. If willing to feel refreshed and beat the summer scorching then land here. Also, you can gather here along with your troop, irrespective of the weather. The famous 12 lane bowling arena also happens to be a part of this massive Bangalore amusement park.

Stocked up with approximately fifty rides, this park in Bangalore has a variety for every age and kind of humans. Adrenaline rush seekers to have their type of swings to swing on like the Crazy Fireball, the name is interesting though. Some of the must do’s are the Frisbee and Devil’s Drop in the water world.

Location: Fun World Amusement Park, Palace Grounds, Jayamahal Main Road, Opposite TV Tower, J.C.Nagar, Bengaluru

Timings: 11 am to 7 pm, you can avail the water rides only till 4:30 pm

Entry fees: 750 per person.

Neeladri Amusement Park

Neeladri Amusement Park is hailed as one of the first few amusement parks to stand out in the map of Bangalore. The place offers everything to make it one of the most entertaining days for you. The park offers different land and water rides where you can spend some amazing time with your loved ones.

The place is a must-visit whether you are a kid or an adult and want to have a nice time in the vicinity of Bangalore with thrilling rides. Moreover, there are also fun games and swings at Neeladari Amusement Park to get your pulse racing when you are there.

Location: Hosur Road, Bangalore

Timings: 11 am to 7 pm

Fantasy Lagoon Water Park

One of the popular amusement parks in Bangalore, Fantasy Lagoon Water Park is a must-visit if you want to get your pulse racing. It is a popular spot for couples to hang out and spend some quality time. The major highlight of Fantasy Lagoon Water Park is its lake where one can enjoy an adventure on different types of speed boats.

One can visit the garden after enjoying a boat ride on the lake. Along with that, families can have a good time here as there is a play area for kids and a lot of refreshment options offering a range of fast food.

Location: Fantasy Lagoon Vengaiana Kere, Near Bake & Cake Bakery, Old Madras Road, K.R Puram, Bangalore- 560036, Karnataka

Timings: 11 am to 8 pm

Entry Fees: INR 30 per head

10

Xtreme Zone Getawayz

Definition of hardcore sports take a twist and are re-defined here. A wide variety of adventure sports will keep your adrenaline flowing during your experience at XtremeZone Getawayz. A mix of Camping, Kayaking, Canoeing, Wind Surfing etc will ensure that you spend your weekends in an active fashion.

Here you can also learn the art of team building under the supervision of professionals at your service, and then play paintball! An adventure world of its own, this is one of the epic and the coolest amusement parks in Bangalore.

Location: 50 Kms from Bangalore on the banks of the Manchan bele lake amid the reserve forests of Savandurga.

Timings: 9:30 am to 6 pm

Entry fees: 1300 INR onwards.

11

Jawahar Bal Bhavan

A cosy little recreation house, stocked with toy trains, tree houses and boats. Also, go gaze at the pretty dolls at the doll museum. A perfect, super budget friendly locale for a fun day out with your kids or friends.

Also, this is a hub for various events and shows, organised for children. Hosting a comfortable and not so hard on your pocket experience, this is considered to be one of the best adventure parks in Bangalore.

Location: Kasturba Road, Ambedkar Veedhi, Sampangi Rama Nagar, Bengaluru.

Timings: 10am to 5:30pm.

Entry fees: INR 10 per person.

12

Lumbini Gardens

Dedicated to the Lord Buddha this is an eco-friendly locale set up for your leisure. Boasting of its boating rides along with other fun rides, this park offers you vivid boating experiences with pedal boats, coffee boats, general boats and battery operated boats.

An artificial beach amidst the beautiful trees brings you an offer to relax in sheer leisure and have a great time with your family and friends. Apart from the above mentioned this park has provisions for organising a birthday treat, get-togethers and professional events. Imagine having a meeting here!

Location: Nagawara lake, ring road, Hebbal, Bengaluru.

Timings: 11 am to 7 pm

Entry fees: Not specified.

13

Crazy Waters

The name itself reveals how fun this park is! The locale is stuffed with vivid rides out of which some must try are the giant water slide, Mini twister, Telecombat, Monorail, Bouncing castles and the wonder wheel.

In total, there are more than half a dozen rides to choose and pick from. However, this locale is now closed.

Location: Bannerghatta Main road, Near Meenakshi temple, Gottigere Village, Bangalore

Timings: Monday to Friday - 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM; Saturday and Sunday - 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM

Entry fees: Adults need to pay 200, while the kids can walk in at 100.

Star City Amusement Park

A subtle locale developing and enhancing with time is popular for its bowling arena. And it isn’t like any other simple bowling ground, it is a grand space with 12 lanes.

So, if rolling is your forte and you are searching for an affordable arena to show off your skills, this is a must to visit. We hope you have a knock out with all ten pins down! And the fun doesn’t end here, go try out all the electronic and semi-robotic games with no age barrier.

Timings: 11 am to 8:30 pm

Entry fees: 120 INR per game

Location: Palace Ground, Near-Post Office, Jayamahal Road, Bengaluru.

Mystery Junkies Escape Rooms

For the fans of crime and detective shows, Mystery Junkies Escape Rooms is one of the places in Bangalore where you can solve some mysteries for real. Locked up in a room, Mystery Junkies Escape Rooms will offer you an experience where you can feel your nerve racing while solving a mystery, a session that lasts for 60 minutes.

It is also a nice experience if you want to bond over some thrill and adventure with friends and colleagues along with making it a fun and memorable activity for everyone.

Location: Koramangala and BEL Road in Bangalore

Timings: 11:30 am to 9:30 pm

Entry Fees: Starting INR 595 per person

VR Room

One of the coolest Bangalore amusement parks for gaming freaks, VR Room is where you can have tons of fun by entering a world of virtual reality that is full of fancy objects. Offering multiplayer spaces, VR Room is a great spot to enjoy a party with your friends and escape into the virtual world.

It is also a nice place to have a team outing with your colleagues as they offer some nice packages for a day full of fun.

Location: The Grid,2nd Floor, Vijay Jatti Building, Beside Empire Hotel, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095

Timings: Mon - Fri: 11:00 AM- 10:00 PM
Sat & Sun: 11:00 AM- 11:00 PM

People Also Ask About Bangalore

  1. Which are the best amusement parks in Bangalore to visit with friends?

    1. Wonderla:  Wonderla is one of the most frequently visited Amusement parks in Bangalore. To have some fun with your group of friends, go for heart-pounding rides like Equinox, hurricane, and Recoil- which is a reverse looping roller coaster, a first of its kind in Bangalore.
    They also have an indoor musical fountain, cinematic 3D rooms, as well as luxury staycations in case you just want to unwind and relax with your buddies after the rides.
    2. Snow City: You don’t need to head to Himachal always when Snow City can give you the same experience in Bangalore. One of the most unique amusement parks in Bangalore, Snow City’s frozen theme is created using eco-friendly ways, and you can go sliding, zorbing, and skiing here. There’s even a 5D theatre for your entertainment. Snow City provides you with boots, gloves and jackets at the entrance itself so don’t worry about carrying it from home. Just get your buddies and have some fun! 
    3. Fun World: One of the most visited amusement parks in Bangalore, this one occupies a massive space with its amusement park, water park and another segment called the Wow Park. To beat the scorching summer heat, head here with your friends and indulge in thrilling rides like the Crazy Fireball, frisbee and devil’s drop. This amusement park also allows you to carry your own food from home, unlike the other parks. 
    4. Smaaash: Based out of several cities, Smaaash has gained popularity for all the right reasons. This one-of-a-kind space in Bangalore promises a day filled with entertainment. This one isn’t like the quintessential amusement parks in Bangalore, and instead offers activities like twilight bowling, finger coaster, cricket, walk the plank, super keeper, go-karting, and even an adult trampoline park! Just grab your gang and head here already, will you? 

  2. How much is the entry fee for Wonderla in Bangalore?

    Wonderla charges INR 890 for adults and INR 720 for kids on weekdays. Weekend rates are INR 1,120 for adults and INR 905 for kids.

  3. How can I get to Wonderla in Bangalore?

    Since Wonderla, unlike the other Amusement parks in Bangalore, is located on the outskirts of the city, reaching the place is more convenient through cabs. However, travelling in BMTC buses will be a pocket-friendly option. These buses run from Majestic, Koramangala, HSR, and ITLP, to Wonderla.

  4. What is the ticket price of Snow City?

    You need to pay INR 650 per person, both on weekdays and weekends, for all the facilities and entertainment inside Snow City.

  5. What is the entry fee for Fun World in Bangalore?

    The entry fee here is INR 800 for adults and INR 500 for kids.

  6. How to reach Bangalore?

    Bangalore is easily accessible from every part of India. You can board a flight and reach Bangalore International Airport, which is around 40 kilometres away from the city. There are several trains plying from major cities to Bangalore as well.

  7. What is the best time to visit Bangalore?

    October to February sees a soothing climate. Winters are pleasant and humidity-free here, so sightseeing becomes a breeze. But you can visit amusement parks in Bangalore anytime, depending on the weather.

Bangalore Top Attractions

Places To Visit In Bangalore
Explore Bangalore
Lal Bagh Botanical Garden

Lalbagh is one of the oldest botanical gardens in India and is also a major tourist attraction in South India. Located in South Bengaluru, the Lalbagh Botanical Garden is not only one of the largest botanical gardens in India, but also the first of its kind, with planned routes, glasshouses and ornamental flowers growing throughout the property.The garden itself is spread over an area of 240 acres and its construction was commissioned by the famous ruler Hyder Ali. It was finally completed by his son- Tipu Sultan- who designed the gardens keeping in mind the beautiful gardens of Sira in Tumkur District in Karnataka.Lalbagh is home to exotic flowers that were imported by the Sultan from countries like France, Persia, Arabia, Afghanistan, etc. Therefore, flowers that were previously never seen in India were first witnessed in this historical garden. Trees that were imported by Tipu Sultan from all over the world can still be found growing here.Apart from the exotic trees, visitors can also catch sight of some rare birds such as the Myna, pond heron, purple moorhen, parakeets, Brahminy kites, the common egret and much more. Apart from the stunning flora and fauna of the Lalbagh Botanical Garden, it has another striking attraction, which is the Lalbagh rock. This rock, which is said to be over 3000 years old, is one of the oldest rocks in the world and can be found in the center of the garden.

Brigade Road

At the intersection of MG road and Residency road lies Brigade road which is considered a shopping paradise for the city dwellers. There is a long stretch of standalone shops, individual retailers, and outlet selling almost everything you need making it one the best Bangalore sightseeing. This commercial hubs houses myriads of global brand outlets as well and it has been a hub for celebrating New Year in the almost every year.

Excellent
It was a very well organised trek by friendly and courteous hosts. Shahid, Danny, Habib and Avinash were great and were fun to trek with. Homestay near Shuntikoppa was beautiful with coffee plantations close-by and it was raining the whole time. Trek is an easy to medium range one. Except for the rain and leeches (which we were informed earlier) there is absolutely nothing to point out in the trek. We met many new people and it felt like college days all over again. Loved this trek and would definitely recommend it to everyone.

Bharathi S Dudhsagar Trek And Dandeli Rafting
Superb

Not so positive There were 13 members but the vehicle arranged had only 12 seats. 4 people had to adjust in 3 seats in last row. It was mentioned that for the trek for half way Jeep will be provided and rest will be trek. However, there was no jeep facility. We did trek for 9kms ‘To’ and while coming back it 14kms way which would have been impossible to cover just by trek. Luckily we found alternative. Also, the next day due to crowd and fall in water level we missed the river rafting which was the main attraction of Dandeli. It was truly disappointing. Had we planned well, we wouldn’t have missed it may be. Overall it was a great experience. Thanks to Thrillophilia and Trek Lead.

28 February 2021
Sai Kiran Kumara Parvatha Trek
Superb
A wonderful & challenging trek - toughest that I have done in South India. The views & the environs at the top of Seshaparvatha were just thrilling. The trek had multitude of elements - forest, grasslands, rocks, a refreshing stream ... Plus the experience of staying in a tent, being in the lap of nature was wonderful The initial part of the trek till Girigadde (on day 1) was exhausting due to the heat and the humidity plus having to carry our luggage along with our tent & sleeping bag. But the second day was all mesmerizing - with that experience, we did not know tiresomeness at all. Few suggestions - 1. It would be great if the hotel where we stop for dinner is vegetarian - it will allow for inclusivity in the group 2. If arrangements could be done to get the tent & sleeping bag delivered at Girigadde, we do not have to carry it along, making the first day experience also enjoyable. Overall a pleasant experience and looking forward to many more
